summary: Returns the total item count for a specified variant in the cart.
name: item_count_for_variant

description:
Accepts the following object types:

- `product`
- `variant`
summary: Returns the subset of cart line items that include a specified product or variant.
name: line_items_for

parameters.description: attribute [string] You can specify the value of supported [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes).
parameters.name: HTML

examples.name: HTML attributes
examples.description: You can specify [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attributes) by including a parameter that matches the attribute name, and the desired value.

summary:
Generates an HTML `<a>` tag with an `href` attribute linking to a collection page that lists all products of the given
product type.
name: link_to_type

parameters.description: attribute [string] [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes) for the link, passed as `attribute: value`.
parameters.name: HTML

examples.name: HTML attributes
examples.description: You can specify [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attributes) by including a parameter that matches the attribute name, and the desired value.

summary:
Generates an HTML `<a>` tag with an `href` attribute linking to a collection page that lists all products of a given
product vendor.
name: link_to_vendor

description:
Accepts the following values:

- `manual`
- `best-selling`
- `title-ascending`
- `title-descending`
- `price-ascending`
- `price-descending`
- `created-ascending`
- `created-descending`

> Tip:
> You can append the `sort_by` filter to the [`url_for_type`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/url_for_type)
> and [`url_for_vendor`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/url_for_vendor) filters.
summary: Generates a collection URL with the provided `sort_by` parameter appended. This filter must be applied to a collection URL.
name: sort_by

summary: Generates a URL for a collection page that lists all products of the given product type.
name: url_for_type

summary: Generates a URL for a collection page that lists all products from the given product vendor.
name: url_for_vendor

description:
When the collection context is included, you can access the associated [`collection` object](/docs/api/liquid/objects/collection)
in the [product template](/themes/architecture/templates/product).

> Caution:
> Because a standard product page and a product page in the context of a collection have the same content on separate
> URLs, you should consider the SEO implications of using the `within` filter.

examples.raw_liquid:
{%- assign collection_product = collection.products.first -%}

{{ collection_product.url | within: collection }}

summary: Generates a product URL within the context of the provided collection.
name: within

description:
> Tip:
> For accessibility best practices, it's recommended to have a minimum brightness difference of 125.

parameters.description: A color to compare with the provided color.
parameters.name: color

summary: Calculates the [perceived brightness difference](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/WD-AERT/#color-contrast) between two colors.
name: brightness_difference

summary: Calculates the [perceived brightness](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/WD-AERT/#color-contrast) of a given color.
name: color_brightness

description:
The order in which you specify the colors doesn't matter.

> Tip:
> For accessibility best practices, the
> [WCAG 2.0 level AA](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?versions=2.0#qr-visual-audio-contrast-contrast) requires a
> minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text, and 3:1 for large text. [Level AAA](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?versions=2.0#qr-visual-audio-contrast7)
> requires a minimum contrast ratio of 7:1 for normal text, and 4.5:1 for large text.

parameters.description: A color to compare with the provided color.
parameters.name: color

summary:
Calculates the contrast ratio between two colors and returns the ratio's numerator. The ratio's denominator, which isn't
returned, is always 1. For example, with a contrast ratio of 3.5:1, this filter returns 3.5.
name: color_contrast

parameters.description: The amount to darken the provided color by.
parameters.name: percent

summary: Darkens a given color by a specific percentage. The percentage must be between 0 and 100.
name: color_darken

parameters.description: The amount to desaturate the provided color by.
parameters.name: percent

summary: Desaturates a given color by a specific percentage. The percentage must be between 0 and 100.
name: color_desaturate

description:
> Tip:
> For accessibility best practices, it's recommended to have a minimum color difference of 500.

parameters.description: A color to compare with the provided color.
parameters.name: color

summary: Calculates the [color difference](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/WD-AERT/#color-contrast) between two colors.
name: color_difference

description:
Accepts the following color components:

- `alpha`
- `red`
- `green`
- `blue`
- `hue`
- `saturation`
- `lightness`

parameters.description: The color component that you want to extract.
parameters.name: color_component

summary: Extracts a specific color component from a given color.
name: color_extract

parameters.description: The amount to lighten the provided color by.
parameters.name: percent

summary: Lightens a given color by a specific percentage. The percentage must be between 0 and 100.
name: color_lighten

description:
> Tip:
> A percentage factor of 100 returns the color being filtered. A percentage factor of 0 returns the color
> supplied to the filter.

parameters.description: A color to mix with the provided color.
parameters.name: color

parameters.description: The percentage amount to mix the colors by.
parameters.name: percent

examples.description: If one input has an alpha component, but the other does not, an alpha component of 1.0 will be assumed for the input without an alpha component.

summary: Blends two colors together by a specific percentage factor. The percentage must be between 0 and 100.
name: color_mix

description:
The following table outlines valid color components, and the value range for their modifications:

| Component | Value range |
| --- | --- |
| <ul><li>`red`</li><li>`green`</li><li>`blue`</li></ul> | An integer between 0 and 255 |
| `alpha` | A decimal between 0 and 1 |
| `hue` | An integer between 0 and 360 |
| <ul><li>`saturation`<li>`lightness`</li></ul> | An integer between 0 and 100 |

parameters.description: The color component that you want to modify.
parameters.name: color_component

parameters.description: The amount to modify the supplied color component by.
parameters.name: modification_value

examples.description: The format of the modified color depends on the component being modified. For example, if you modify the `alpha` component of a color in hexadecimal format, then the modified color will be in `rgba()` format.

summary: Modifies a specific color component of a given color by a specific amount.
name: color_modify

parameters.description: The amount to saturate the provided color by.
parameters.name: percent

summary: Saturates a given color by a specific percentage. The percentage must be between 0 and 100.
name: color_saturate

description:
Because colors are converted to `hex6` format, if a color with an alpha component is provided, then the alpha component
is excluded from the output.
summary: Converts a CSS color string to hexadecimal format (`hex6`).
name: color_to_hex

description: If a color with an alpha component is provided, the color is converted to `HSLA` format.
summary: Converts a CSS color string to `HSL` format.
name: color_to_hsl

description: If a color with an alpha component is provided, then the color is converted to `RGBA` format.
summary: Converts a CSS color string to `RGB` format.
name: color_to_rgb

deprecation_reason:
The `hex_to_rgba` filter has been replaced by [`color_to_rgb`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/color_to_rgb) and
[`color_modify`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/color_modify).

parameters.description: The desired alpha value.
parameters.name: alpha

examples.name: alpha
examples.description: The default `alpha` value is 1.0. However, you can specify a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0.

summary: Converts a CSS color string from  hexadecimal format to `RGBA` format. Shorthand hexadecimal formatting (`hex3`) is also accepted.
name: hex_to_rgba

description: The secret key for the message is supplied as a parameter to the filter.

examples.raw_liquid:
{%- assign secret_potion = 'Polyjuice' | hmac_sha1: 'Polina' -%}

My secret potion: {{ secret_potion }}

summary: Converts a string into an SHA-1 hash using a hash message authentication code (HMAC).
name: hmac_sha1

description: The secret key for the message is supplied as a parameter to the filter.

examples.raw_liquid:
{%- assign secret_potion = 'Polyjuice' | hmac_sha256: 'Polina' -%}

My secret potion: {{ secret_potion }}

summary: Converts a string into an SHA-256 hash using a hash message authentication code (HMAC).
name: hmac_sha256

summary: Converts a string into an MD5 hash.
name: md5

examples.raw_liquid:
{%- assign secret_potion = 'Polyjuice' | sha1 -%}

My secret potion: {{ secret_potion }}

summary: Converts a string into an SHA-1 hash.
name: sha1

examples.raw_liquid:
{%- assign secret_potion = 'Polyjuice' | sha256 -%}

My secret potion: {{ secret_potion }}

summary: Converts a string into an SHA-256 hash.
name: sha256

deprecation_reason:
Deprecated without a direct replacement because the [currency form](/docs/api/liquid/tags/form#form-currency) has also been
deprecated. The currency form was replaced by the [localization form](/docs/api/liquid/tags/form#form-localization). Refer to
this guide which explains [how to create a country selector](/docs/themes/markets/multiple-currencies-languages#implementing-country-and-language-selectors)
using the localization form.
description:
The `currency_selector` filter must be applied to the [`form` object](/docs/api/liquid/objects/form) within a
[currency form](/docs/api/liquid/tags/form#form-currency).

parameters.name: class

parameters.name: id

examples.description: Specify the `class` attribute of the `<select>` element.

examples.name: id
examples.description: Specify the `id` attribute of the `<select>` element.

summary: Generates an HTML `<select>` element with an option for each currency available on the store.
name: currency_selector

summary: Generates an HTML link to the customer login page.
name: customer_login_link

summary: Generates an HTML link to log the customer out of their account and redirect to the homepage.
name: customer_logout_link

summary: Generates an HTML link to the customer registration page.

description:
The `date` filter accepts the same parameters as Ruby's strftime method for formatting the date. For a list of shorthand
formats, refer to the [Ruby documentation](https://ruby-doc.org/core-3.1.1/Time.html#method-i-strftime) or
[strftime reference and sandbox](http://www.strfti.me/).

parameters.description: The desired date format.
parameters.name: format

examples.name: The current date
examples.description:
You can apply the `date` filter to the keywords `'now'` and `'today'` to output the current timestamp.

> Note:
> The timestamp will reflect the time that the Liquid was last rendered. Because of this, the timestamp might not be updated for every page view, depending on the context and caching.

examples.name: format
examples.description:
Specify a locale-aware date format. You can use the following formats:

- `abbreviated_date`
- `basic`
- `date`
- `date_at_time`
- `default`
- `on_date`
- `short` (deprecated)
- `long` (deprecated)

> Note:
> You can also [define custom formats](/docs/api/liquid/filters/date-setting-format-options-in-locale-files) in your theme's locale files.

examples.name: Setting format options in locale files

summary: Converts a timestamp into another date format.
name: date

parameters.description: [string] Customize the [`font_display` property](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-display) of the `@font-face` declaration.
parameters.name: font_display

examples.name: font_display
examples.description: You can include an optional parameter to specify the [`font_display` property](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-display) of the `@font_face` declaration.

summary: Generates a CSS [`@font_face` declaration](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/%40font-face) to load the provided font.
name: font_face

parameters.description: Font property to modify
parameters.name: property

parameters.description: The new value for the associated property.
parameters.name: value

examples.name: Non-existent font variants
examples.description: If the `font_modify` filter tries to create a font variant that doesn't exist, then it returns `nil`. To handle this, you can either assign a fallback value with the [`default` filter](/docs/api/liquid/filters/default), or check for `nil` before using the variant.

summary: Modifies a specific property of a given font.
name: font_modify

parameters.description: Choose to return the URL for the font in `woff` format, instead of `woff2`.
parameters.name: font_type

examples.name: woff format
examples.description: By default, the `font_url` filter returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for the font in `woff2` format. However, you can also choose `woff` format.

summary: Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for the provided font in `woff2` format.
name: font_url

summary: Generates default error messages for each possible value of [`form.errors`](/docs/themes/liquid/reference/objects/form#form-errors).
name: default_errors

description:
> Note:
> You can't render dynamic checkout buttons through AJAX requests, including those through the
> [Section Rendering API](/api/section-rendering). The dynamic checkout buttons are added by JavaScript included
> by Shopify through the [`content_for_header`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/content_for_header) object, which only runs on
> the initial page load.
summary:
Generates an HTML container to host [dynamic checkout buttons](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/dynamic-checkout)
for a product. The `payment_button` filter must be used on the `form` object within a [product form](/docs/api/liquid/tags/form#form-product).
name: payment_button

summary: Generates the HTML for the [Shop Pay Installments banner](/themes/pricing-payments/installments).
name: payment_terms

description:
The `time_tag` filter accepts the same parameters as Ruby's strftime method for formatting the date. For a list of shorthand
formats, refer to the [Ruby documentation](https://ruby-doc.org/core-3.1.1/Time.html#method-i-strftime) or
[strftime reference and sandbox](http://www.strfti.me/).

parameters.description: The desired date format.
parameters.name: format

examples.name: format
examples.description:
Specify a locale-aware date format. Accepts the following values:

- `abbreviated_date`
- `basic`
- `date`
- `date_at_time`
- `default`
- `on_date`
- `short` (deprecated)
- `long` (deprecated)

> Note:
> You can also [define custom formats](/docs/api/liquid/filters/date-setting-format-options-in-locale-files) in your theme's locale files.

examples.name: datetime
examples.description: By default, the value of the `datetime` attribute of the `<time>` tag is formatted as `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD`. However, you can specify a custom format with [strftime shorthand formats](https://ruby-doc.org/core-3.1.2/Time.html#method-i-strftime).

examples.name: Setting format options in locale files

summary: Converts a timestamp into an HTML `<time>` tag.
name: time_tag

description:
The `translate` filter has an alias of `t`, which is more commonly used.

> Tip:
> To learn more about using the `t` filter, refer to [storefront locale file usage](/themes/architecture/locales/storefront-locale-files#usage)
> or [schema locale file usage](/themes/architecture/locales/schema-locale-files#usage).

examples.name: Section locales vs. theme locales
examples.description:
The `t` filter can also reference keys defined in the [`locales` object](/themes/architecture/sections/section-schema#locales) of section file's `schema` tag. Content that you put in the `schema` under the `locales` object is only accessible to that section. This is useful if you need to make a standalone section that you want to share between themes.

Content that is global to a theme should be placed in the theme's `locales` directory. For example, you could include the expression "See more" in your `locales` directory to create a single translation. You could then use the translation in a blog post and on the product details page.

> Note:
> Translations in the section's `schema` tag that aren't part of the `locales` object are used for merchant-facing text shown in the theme editor. These translations don't use the `t` filter.

summary: Returns a string of translated text for a given translation key from a [locale file](/themes/architecture/locales).
name: translate

description:
> Tip:
> When using the JSON output in JavaScript, you don't need to wrap it in quotes because the `json` filter includes them.
> The `json` filter also escapes any quotes inside the output.

#### Product inventory

When applied to a [`product` object](/docs/api/liquid/objects/product) on any Shopify store created after December 5, 2017, the
`json` filter doesn't output values for the `inventory_quantity` and `inventory_policy` properties of any associated
[variants](/docs/api/liquid/objects/variant). These properties are excluded to help prevent bots and crawlers from retrieving
inventory quantities for stores to which they aren't granted access.

If you need inventory information, you can access it through individual variants.
summary: Converts a string, or object, into JSON format.
name: json

summary: Returns the absolute value of a number.
name: abs

examples.raw_liquid:
{%-  assign path = product.url -%}

{{ request.origin | append: path }}

summary: Adds a given string to the end of a string.
name: append

summary: Limits a number to a minimum value.
name: at_least

summary: Limits a number to a maximum value.
name: at_most

summary: Decodes a string in [Base64 format](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Base64).
name: base64_decode

summary: Encodes a string to [Base64 format](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Base64).
name: base64_encode

summary: Decodes a string in URL-safe [Base64 format](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Base64).
name: base64_url_safe_decode

examples.description: To produce URL-safe Base64, this filter uses `-` and `_` in place of `+` and `/`.

summary: Encodes a string to URL-safe [Base64 format](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Base64).
name: base64_url_safe_encode

examples.raw_liquid: {{ 'this sentence should start with a capitalized word.' | capitalize }}

summary: Capitalizes the first word in a string and downcases the remaining characters.
name: capitalize

summary: Rounds a number up to the nearest integer.
name: ceil

summary: Removes any `nil` items from an array.
name: compact

description:
> Note:
> The `concat` filter won't filter out duplicates. If you want to remove duplicates, then you need to use the
> [`uniq` filter](/docs/api/liquid/filters/uniq).
summary: Concatenates (combines) two arrays.
name: concat

parameters.description: Whether to use false values instead of the default.
parameters.name: allow_false

examples.name: allow_false
examples.description: By default, the  `default` filter's value will be used in place of `false` values. You can use the `allow_false` parameter to allow variables to return `false` instead of the default value.
examples.raw_liquid:
{%- assign display_price = false -%}

{{ display_price | default: true, allow_false: true }}

summary:
Sets a default value for any variable whose value is one of the following:

- [`empty`](/docs/api/liquid/basics#empty)
- [`false`](/docs/api/liquid/basics#truthy-and-falsy)
- [`nil`](/docs/api/liquid/basics#nil)
name: default

summary: Divides a number by a given number. The `divided_by` filter produces a result of the same type as the divisor. This means if you divide by an integer, the result will be an integer, and if you divide by a float, the result will be a float.
name: divided_by

summary: Converts a string to all lowercase characters.
name: downcase

summary: Escapes special characters in HTML, such as `<>`, `'`, and `&`, and converts characters into escape sequences. The filter doesn't effect characters within the string that dont have a corresponding escape sequence.".
name: escape

summary: Escapes a string without changing characters that have already been escaped.
name: escape_once

examples.name: Dot notation
examples.description: You can use the `first` filter with dot notation when you need to use it inside a tag or object output.

summary: Returns the first item in an array.
name: first

summary: Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.
name: floor

examples.name: Custom separator
examples.description: You can specify a custom separator for the joined items.

summary: Combines all of the items in an array into a single string, separated by a space.

examples.name: Dot notation

{{ product_titles | join: ', ' }}

examples.name: Reversing strings
examples.description: You can't use the `reverse` filter on strings directly. However, you can use the [`split` filter](/docs/api/liquid/filters/split) to create an array of characters in the string, reverse that array, and then use the [`join` filter](/docs/api/liquid/filters/join) to combine them again.

name: reverse

description:
The size of a string is the number of characters that the string includes. The size of an array is the number of items
in the array.

examples.name: Dot notation
examples.description: You can use the `size` filter with dot notation when you need to use it inside a tag or object output.

summary: Returns the size of a string or array.
name: size

description:
By default, the substring has a length of one character, and the array series has one array item. However, you can
provide a second parameter to specify the number of characters or array items.

examples.name: Negative index
examples.description: You can supply a negative index which will count from the end of the string.

summary: Returns a substring or series of array items, starting at a given 0-based index.
name: slice

examples.name: Sort by an array item property
examples.description: You can specify an array item property to sort the array items by. You can sort by any property of the object that you're sorting.

summary: Sorts the items in an array in case-sensitive alphabetical, or numerical, order.
name: sort

description:
> Caution:
> You shouldn't use the `sort_natural` filter to sort numerical values. When comparing items an array, each item is converted to a
> string, so sorting on numerical values can lead to unexpected results.

examples.name: Sort by an array item property
examples.description: You can specify an array item property to sort the array items by.

summary: Sorts the items in an array in case-insensitive alphabetical order.
name: sort_natural

summary: Splits a string into an array of substrings based on a given separator.
name: split

name: strip

name: strip_html

summary: Returns the sum of all elements in an array.
name: sum

summary: Multiplies a number by a given number.
name: times

description:
If the specified number of characters is less than the length of the string, then an ellipsis (`...`) is appended to
the truncated string. The ellipsis is included in the character count of the truncated string.

examples.name: Specify a custom ellipsis
examples.description: You can provide a second parameter to specify a custom ellipsis. If you don't want an ellipsis, then you can supply an empty string.

summary: Truncates a string down to a given number of characters.
name: truncate

description:
If the specified number of words is less than the number of words in the string, then an ellipsis (`...`) is appended to
the truncated string.

> Caution:
> HTML tags are treated as words, so you should strip any HTML from truncated content. If you don't strip HTML, then
> closing HTML tags can be removed, which can result in unexpected behavior.

examples.name: Specify a custom ellipsis
examples.description: You can provide a second parameter to specify a custom ellipsis. If you don't want an ellipsis, then you can supply an empty string.
examples.raw_liquid:
{{ article.content | strip_html | truncatewords: 15, '--' }}

{{ article.content | strip_html | truncatewords: 15, '' }}

summary: Truncates a string down to a given number of words.
name: truncatewords

examples.raw_liquid:
{% assign potion_array = 'invisibility, health, love, health, invisibility' | split: ', ' %}

{{ potion_array | uniq | join: ', ' }}

summary: Removes any duplicate items in an array.
name: uniq

summary: Converts a string to all uppercase characters.
name: upcase

summary:
Decodes any [percent-encoded](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/percent-encoding) characters
in a string.
name: url_decode

description:
> Note:
> Spaces are converted to a `+` character, instead of a percent-encoded character.
summary:
Converts any URL-unsafe characters in a string to the
[percent-encoded](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/percent-encoding) equivalent.
name: url_encode

description: This requires you to provide both the property name and the associated value.

description:
If [alt text is set on the video](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/products/product-media/add-alt-text), then it's
included in the `title` attribute of the `<iframe>`. If no alt text is set, then the `title` attribute is set to the
product title.

examples.name: HTML attributes
examples.description: You can specify [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/iframe#attributes) by adding a parameter that matches the attribute name, and the desired value.

summary:
Generates an HTML `<iframe>` tag containing the player for a given external video. The input for the `external_video_tag`
filter can be either a [`media` object](/docs/api/liquid/objects/media) or [`external_video_url`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/external_video_url).
name: external_video_tag

examples.description: You can specify [YouTube](https://developers.google.com/youtube/player_parameters#Parameters) and [Vimeo](https://vimeo.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001494447-Using-Player-Parameters) video parameters by adding a parameter that matches the parameter name, and the desired value.

summary:
Returns the URL for a given external video. Use this filter to specify parameters for the external video player generated
by the [`external_video_tag` filter](/docs/api/liquid/filters/external_video_tag).
name: external_video_url

description:
By default, `width` and `height` attributes are added to the `<img>` tag based on the dimensions and aspect ratio from
the image URL. However, you can override these attributes with the [width](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_tag#image_tag-width) and [height](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_tag#image_tag-height)
parameters. If only one parameter is provided, then only that attribute is added.

> Note:
> This filter automatically applies the `object-position` css style from the focal point value if set. For more
> information, refer to the [`focal_point` object](/docs/api/liquid/objects/focal_point).

parameters.description: The width of the image.
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: The height of the image.
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: The source sizes for responsiveness.
parameters.name: sizes

parameters.description: The widths to associate with custom `srcset` values.
parameters.name: widths

parameters.description: The `srcset` for responsiveness.
parameters.name: srcset

parameters.description: Whether the resource should be preloaded.
parameters.name: preload

parameters.description: The image's alt text.
parameters.name: alt

examples.name: width
examples.description: Specify the `width` attribute of the `<img>` tag. You can set the parameter to `nil` to prevent the attribute from being added.

examples.name: height
examples.description: Specify the `height` attribute of the `<img>` tag. You can set the parameter to `nil` to prevent the attribute from being added.

examples.name: sizes
examples.description: Specify source sizes with the [HTML `sizes` attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#attr-sizes).
examples.raw_liquid: {{ product | image_url: width: 200 | image_tag: sizes: '(min-width:1600px) 960px, (min-width: 750px) calc((100vw - 11.5rem) / 2), calc(100vw - 4rem)' }}

examples.name: widths
examples.description: By default, Shopify generates a `srcset` with a smart set of default widths up to the maximum defined in the image URL. However, you can create your own set of widths.

examples.name: srcset
examples.description:
By default, Shopify generates a `srcset`. However, you can create your own `srcset`.
The `srcset` parameter takes precedence over the [`width` parameter](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_tag#image_tag-width).
You shouldn't to use the `srcset` parameter unless you want to remove the attribute by setting the parameter to `nil`.
examples.raw_liquid: {{ product | image_url: width: 200 | image_tag: srcset: nil }}

examples.name: preload
examples.description:
Specify whether the image should be preloaded.

When `preload` is set to `true`, a resource hint is sent as a [Link HTTP header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Link)
with a `rel` value of [`preload`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types/preload).
The Link header also includes `imagesrcset` and `imagesizes` that match the `srcset` and `sizes` attribute of the tag,
where present:

```liquid
Link: <IMAGE_URL>; rel=preload; as=image
Link: <IMAGE_URL>; rel=preload; as=image; imagesrcset=ADDITIONAL_IMAGE_URL 352w; imagesizes=40vw
```

This option doesn't affect the HTML img tag directly.

You should use the preload parameter sparingly. For example, consider preloading only above-the-fold images.
To learn more about resource hints in Shopify themes, refer to [Performance best practices for Shopify themes](/themes/best-practices/performance#preload-key-resources-defer-or-avoid-loading-others).

examples.name: alt
examples.description: By default, the `alt` attribute of the `<img>` tag is set to the [media alt text](https://help.shopify.com/manual/products/product-media/add-alt-text), or the resource title for article, collection, line item, product, and variant images. However, you can override this default, or set the value if there's no default.
examples.raw_liquid: {{ product | image_url: width: 200 | image_tag: alt: "My image's alt text" }}

examples.name: HTML attributes
examples.description: You can specify [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#attributes) by adding a parameter that matches the attribute name, and the desired value.
examples.raw_liquid: {{ product | image_url: width: 200 | image_tag: class: 'custom-class', loading: 'lazy' }}

summary: Generates an HTML `<img>` tag for a given [`image_url`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_url).
name: image_tag

parameters.description: The dimensions of the media's poster image.
parameters.name: image_size

examples.name: image_size
examples.description: Specify the dimensions of the media's poster image in pixels.

summary: Generates an appropriate HTML tag for a given media object.
name: media_tag

parameters.description: The dimensions of the model viewer's poster image.
parameters.name: image_size

examples.name: Model viewer attributes
examples.description:
By default, the model viewer component has the following attributes:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `alt` | `[alt-text]` - The media's alt text. |
| `poster` | `[preview-image-url]` - The media's preview image URL. |
| `camera-controls` | N/A - Allows for controls via mouse/touch. |

You can override these attributes, or any [supported model viewer component attributes](https://modelviewer.dev/docs/index.html#stagingandcameras-attributes) by adding a parameter that matches the attribute name, and the desired value.

examples.name: image_size
examples.description: Specify the dimensions of the model's poster image in pixels.

summary: Generates a [Google model viewer component](https://modelviewer.dev/) for a given 3D model.
name: model_viewer_tag

description:
> Note:
> When `mp4` videos are uploaded, Shopify generates an `m3u8` file as an additional [`video_source`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/video_source).
> An `m3u8` file enables video players to leverage [HTTP live streaming (HLS)](https://developer.apple.com/streaming/),
> resulting in an optimized video experience based on the user's internet connection. If loop is enabled, the HLS source is not used
> in order to allow progessive download to cache the video.
>
> If the `m3u8` source isn't supported, then the player falls back to the `mp4` source.

parameters.description: The dimensions of the video's poster image.
parameters.name: image_size

examples.name: image_size
examples.description: Specify the dimensions of the video's poster image in pixels.

examples.name: Optional supported HTML5 attributes
examples.description:
`video_tag` supports all [HTML5 video attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/video#attributes).
For example:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `autoplay` | Whether to automatically play the video after its loaded. Accepted values:`true`,`false`|
| `loop` | Whether to loop the video. Accepted values:`true`,`false`|
| `muted` | Whether to mute the videos audio. Accepted values:`true`,`false`|
| `controls` | Whether a user can control the video playback. Accepted values:`true`,`false`|

summary: Generates an HTML `<video>` tag for a given video.
name: video_tag

description:
> Note:
> The `metafield_tag` filter doesn't support list metafields other than `list.single_line_text_field`.

examples.name: Basic types
examples.description:
Most metafield types return a simple HTML element:

| Type | Element | Attributes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `boolean` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-boolean"` |
| `collection_reference` | `<a>` | `class="metafield-collection_reference"` |
| `color` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-color"` |
| `date` | `<time>` | `datetime="<the metafield value>"`<br><br>`class="metafield-date"`<br><br>Value is localized to the customer |
| `date_time` | `<time>` | `datetime="<the metafield value>"`<br><br>`class="metafield-date"`<br><br>Value is localized to the customer |
| `json` | `<script>` | `type="application/json"`<br><br>`class="metafield-json"` |
| `money` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-money"`<br><br>Value is formatted using the store's [HTML with currency setting](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/currency-formatting) |
| `multi_line_text_field` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-multi_line_text_field"` |
| `number_decimal` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-number_decimal"` |
| `number_integer` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-number_integer"` |
| `page_reference` | `<a>` | `class="metafield-page_reference"` |
| `product_reference` | `<a>` | `class="metafield-page_reference"` |
| `rating` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-rating"` | |
| `single_line_text_field` | `<span>` | `class="metafield-single_line_text_field"` |
| `url` | `<a>` | `class="metafield-url"` |
| `variant_reference` | `<a>` | `class="metafield-variant_reference"` |
| `rich_text_field` | `<div>` | `class="metafield-rich_text_field"` |

examples.name: Complex types
examples.description:
The following metafield types return nested elements, or different elements depending on the metafield contents:

- [`dimension`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/metafield_tag#metafield_tag-dimension)
- [`file_reference`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/metafield_tag#metafield_tag-file_reference)
- [`list.single_line_text_field`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/metafield_tag#metafield_tag-list.single_line_text_field)
- [`volume`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/metafield_tag#metafield_tag-volume)
- [`weight`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/metafield_tag#metafield_tag-weight)

examples.name: dimension
examples.description:
Outputs a `<span>` element with the following attribute:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `class` | `metafield-dimension` |

The `<span>` element contains the following child elements:

| Child element | HTML element | Attributes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| The dimension value.<br><br>If it's a decimal with more than two places, then it'll be formatted to have a precision of two with trailing zeros removed. | `<span>` | `class="metafield-dimension_value"` |
| The dimension unit. | `<span>` | `class="metafield-dimension_unit"` |

examples.name: file_reference
examples.description:
The output varies depending on the type of file. There are the following categories of file type:

| File type | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Image | Images in the format of `jpg`, `png`, `gif`, `heic`, and `webp`. |
| Video | Videos in the format of `mov`, and `mp4`. |
| Other | Any other file type. |

##### Image

Outputs an `<img>` element with the following attributes:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `src` | The image's URL. |
| `alt` | The image's alt text. |
| `class` | `metafield-file_reference` |

##### Video

Outputs a `<video>` element with the following attributes:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `src` | The video's URL. |
| `poster` | The video's preview image (poster) URL. |
| `playsinline` | N/A - Indicates the video will be played "inline" within the element's playback area. |
| `preload` | `metadata` - Only metadata is pre-fetched before the video is played. |

The `<video>` element contains the following child elements:

| Child element | HTML element | Attributes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| The video's multimedia playlist source, for [HTTP live streaming (HLS)](https://developer.apple.com/streaming/) | `<source>` | `src="<the video's m3u8 source URL>"`<br><br>`type="application/x-mpegURL"` |
| The video's original source | `<source>` | `src="<the video's source URL>"`<br><br>`type="<the video's original source MIME type>"` |
| The video's preview (poster) image | `<img>` | `src="<the video's preview image URL>"` |

##### Other

Outputs an `<a>` element with a link to the file and the following attribute:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `class` | `metafield-file_reference` |

The `<a>` element contains an `<img>` element for the file's [preview image](/docs/api/liquid/objects/generic_file#generic_file-preview_image) with the following attributes:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `src` | The file's preview image URL. |
| `loading` | `lazy` - The image isn't loaded until it's almost in view. |

examples.name: list.single_line_text_field
examples.description:
Outputs a `<ul>` element by default with the following attribute:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `class` | `metafield-single_line_text_field-array` |

The `<ul>` element contains an `<li>` element for each item in the list with a `class` of `metafield-single_line_text_field`.

To output an `<ol>` element, pass the `list_format` parameter with a value of `ordered`.

examples.name: volume
examples.description:
Outputs a `<span>` element with the following attribute:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `class` | `metafield-volume` |

The `<span>` element contains the following child elements:

| Child element | HTML element | Attributes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| The volume value.<br><br>If it's a decimal with more than two places, then it'll be formatted to have a precision of two with trailing zeros removed. | `<span>` | `class="metafield-volume_value"` |
| The volume unit. | `<span>` | `class="metafield-volume_unit"` |

examples.name: weight
examples.description:
Outputs a `<span>` element with the following attribute:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `class` | `metafield-weight` |

The `<span>` element contains the following child elements:

| Child element | HTML element | Attributes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| The weight value.<br><br>If it's a decimal with more than two places, then it'll be formatted to have a precision of two with trailing zeros removed. | `<span>` | `class="metafield-weight_value"` |
| The weight unit. | `<span>` | `class="metafield-weight_unit"` |

summary:
Generates an HTML element to host the metafield data. The type of element that's generated differs depending on the
type of metafield.
name: metafield_tag

description:
The following outlines the output for each metafield type:

| Metafield type | Output |
| --- | --- |
| `single_line_text_field` | The metafield text. |
| `multi_line_text_field` | The metafield text. |
| `page_reference` | The page title. |
| `product_reference` | The product title. |
| `collection_reference` | The collection title. |
| `variant_reference` | The variant title. |
| `file_reference` | The file URL. |
| `number_integer` | The number. |
| `number_decimal` | The number. |
| `date` | The date. |
| `date-time` | The date and time. |
| `url` | The URL. |
| `json` | The JSON. |
| `boolean` | The boolean value. |
| `color` | The color value. |
| `weight` | The weight value and unit.<br><br>If the value is a decimal with more than two places, then it'll be formatted to have a precision of two with trailing zeros removed. |
| `volume` | The volume value and unit.<br><br>If the value is a decimal with more than two places, then it'll be formatted to have a precision of two with trailing zeros removed. |
| `dimension` | The dimension value and unit.<br><br>If the value is a decimal with more than two places, then it'll be formatted to have a precision of two with trailing zeros removed. |
| `rating` | The rating value. |
| `list.single_line_text_field` | The metafield values converted to a sentence.<br><br>For example, if you had the values `Toronto`, `Ottawa`, and `Vancouver`, then the output would be:<br><br>`Toronto, Ottawa, and Vancouver` |
| `money` | The money value, formatted using the store's [**HTML with currency** setting](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/currency-formatting). |
| `rich_text_field` | The rich text value as simple text. |
summary: Generates a text version of the metafield data.
name: metafield_text

summary: Formats a given price based on the store's [**HTML without currency** setting](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/currency-formatting).
name: money

summary: Formats a given price based on the store's [**HTML with currency** setting](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/currency-formatting).
name: money_with_currency

summary: Formats a given price based on the store's [**HTML without currency** setting](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/currency-formatting), without the currency symbol.
name: money_without_currency

summary:
Formats a given price based on the store's [**HTML without currency** setting](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/currency-formatting), excluding the decimal separator
(either `.` or `,`) and trailing zeros.

If the price has a non-zero decimal value, then the output is the same as the [`money` filter](/docs/api/liquid/filters#money).
name: money_without_trailing_zeros

summary: Generates HTML for a set of links for paginated results. Must be applied to the [`paginate` object](/docs/api/liquid/objects/paginate).
name: default_pagination

description:
Configure the storefront for Follow on Shop. [Learn more](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/customizing-themes/follow-on-shop)

> Note:
> The presence of the [Shop](/docs/api/liquid/objects/shop) object
> is required for validation purposes only.

> Note:
> The `action` specified is always `'follow'`. If this parameter is not supplied the button will not render.

```liquid
{{ shop | login_button: action: 'follow' }}
```

parameters.description: Specify 'follow' for the follow flow.
parameters.name: action

summary: Generates an HTML Button that enables a customer to follow the Shop in the Shop App
name: login_button

summary: Converts a string to CamelCase.
name: camelize

description:
> Note:
> The `handleize` filter has an alias of `handle`.
summary: Converts a string into a [handle](/docs/api/liquid/basics#handles).
name: handleize

summary: Escapes any URL-unsafe characters in a string.
name: url_escape

description:
The `url_param_escape` filter escapes the same characters as [`url_escape`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/url_escape), with the
addition of `&`.
summary: Escapes any characters in a string that are unsafe for URL parameters.
name: url_param_escape

summary:
Wraps a given tag in an HTML `<span>` tag, with a `class` attribute of `active`, if the tag is currently active. Only
applies to collection tags.
name: highlight_active_tag

description:
> Tip:
> To learn more about filtering by tag, refer to [Filter articles by tag](/themes/architecture/templates/blog#filter-articles-by-tag)
> or [Filter collections by tag](/themes/navigation-search/filtering/tag-filtering).
summary:
Generates an HTML `<a>` tag with an `href` attribute linking to the current blog or collection, filtered to show
only articles or products that have a given tag, as well as any currently active tags.
name: link_to_add_tag

description:
> Tip:
> To learn more about filtering by tag, refer to [Filter articles by tag](/themes/architecture/templates/blog#filter-articles-by-tag)
> or [Filter collections by tag](/themes/navigation-search/filtering/tag-filtering).
summary:
Generates an HTML `<a>` tag with an `href` attribute linking to the current blog or collection, filtered to show
only articles or products that have any currently active tags, except the provided tag.
name: link_to_remove_tag

description:
> Tip:
> To learn more about filtering by tag, refer to [Filter articles by tag](/themes/architecture/templates/blog#filter-articles-by-tag)
> or [Filter collections by tag](/themes/navigation-search/filtering/tag-filtering).
summary:
Generates an HTML `<a>` tag with an `href` attribute linking to the current blog or collection, filtered to show
only articles or products that have a given tag.
name: link_to_tag

summary: Generates an HTML address display, with each address component ordered according to the address's locale.
name: format_address

parameters.description: The string that you want to highlight.
parameters.name: highlighted_term

summary:
Wraps all instances of a specific string, within a given string, with an HTML `<strong>` tag with a `class` attribute
of `highlight`.
name: highlight

description:
> Caution:
> The `pluralize` filter applies English pluralization rules to determine which string to output. You shouldn't use this
> filter on non-English strings because it could lead to incorrect pluralizations.

examples.raw_liquid: Cart item count: {{ cart.item_count }} {{ cart.item_count | pluralize: 'item', 'items' }}

summary: Outputs the singular or plural version of a string based on a given number.
name: pluralize

examples.name: size
examples.description: By default, the `article_img_url` filter returns the `small` version of the image (100 x 100 px). However, you can specify a [size](/docs/api/liquid/filters/img_url#img_url-size).

name: article_img_url

Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for an image in the

Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for an image from the

Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for a file from the
[Files](https://www.shopify.com/admin/settings/files) page of the Shopify admin.
name: file_url

description:
Global assets are kept in a directory on Shopify's server. Using global assets can be faster than loading the resource
directly.

Depending on the resource type, you might need to use an additional filter to load the resource. The following table
outlines which filter to use for specific resource types.

| Resource type | Additional filter |
| --- | --- |
| JavaScript (`.js`) | [`script_tag`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/script_tag) |
| CSS (`.css`) | [`stylesheet_tag`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/stylesheet_tag)  |

The following table outlines the available global assets:

| Category | Assets |
| --- | --- |
| Firebug | - `firebug/firebug.css`<br>- `firebug/firebug.html`<br>- `firebug/firebug.js`<br>- `firebug/firebugx.js`<br>- `firebug/errorIcon.png`<br>- `firebug/infoIcon.png`<br>- `firebug/warningIcon.png` |
| JavaScript libraries | - `controls.js`<br>- `dragdrop.js`<br>- `effects.js`<br>- `ga.js`<br>- `mootools.js` |
| Lightbox | - `lightbox.css`<br>- `lightbox.js`<br><br>- `lightbox/v1/lightbox.css`<br>- `lightbox/v1/lightbox.js`<br><br>- `lightbox/v2/lightbox.css`<br>- `lightbox/v2/lightbox.js`<br>- `lightbox/v2/close.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v2/loading.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v2/overlay.png`<br>- `lightbox/v2/zoom-lg.gif`<br><br>- `lightbox/v204/lightbox.css`<br>- `lightbox/v204/lightbox.js`<br>- `lightbox/v204/bullet.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v204/close.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v204/closelabel.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v204/donatebutton.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v204/downloadicon.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v204/loading.gif`<br>- `lightbox/v204/nextlabel.png`<br>- `lightbox/v204/prevlabel.gif` |
| Prototype | - `prototype.js`<br>- `prototype/1.5/prototype.js`<br>- `prototype/1.6/prototype.js` |
| script.aculo.us | - `scriptaculous/1.8.2/scriptaculous.js`<br>- `scriptaculous/1.8.2/builder.js`<br>- `scriptaculous/1.8.2/controls.js`<br>- `scriptaculous/1.8.2/dragdrop.js`<br>- `scriptaculous/1.8.2/effects.js`<br>- `scriptaculous/1.8.2/slider.js`<br>- `scriptaculous/1.8.2/sound.js`<br>- `scriptaculous/1.8.2/unittest.js` |
| Shopify | - `list-collection.css`<br>- `textile.css` |
summary: Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for a global asset.
name: global_asset_url

description:
You can use the `image_url` filter on the following objects, as well as their `src` property:

- [`article`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/article)
- [`collection`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/collection)
- [`image`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/image)
- [`line_item`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/line_item)
- [`product`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/product)
- [`variant`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/variant)
- [`country`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/country)

> Caution:
> You need to specify either a [`width`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_url#image_url-width) or
> [`height`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_url#image_url-height) parameter. If neither are specified, then an error is returned.

> Note:
> Regardless of the specified dimensions, an image can never be resized to be larger than its original dimensions.

parameters.description: How the image should be cropped to match the desired dimensions.
parameters.name: crop

parameters.description: The file format for the image.
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: The padding color, if the provided image is smaller than the requested dimensions.
parameters.name: pad_color

parameters.description: The desired image width, in pixels.
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: The desired image height, in pixels.
parameters.name: height

examples.name: width
examples.description: Specify the width of the image up to a maximum of `5760px`. If only the width is specified, then the height is automatically calculated based on the image's dimensions.

examples.name: height
examples.description: Specify the height of the image up to a maximum of `5760px`. If only the height is specified, then the width is automatically calculated based on the image's dimensions.

examples.name: crop
examples.description:
Specify which part of the image to show if the specified dimensions result in an aspect ratio that differs from the original. You can use the following values:

- `top`
- `center`
- `bottom`
- `left`
- `right`
- `region`

The default value is `center`.

When using the `region` crop mode, the starting point for the crop is defined by `crop_left` and `crop_top` and extends to the `crop_width` and `crop_height`.
Optionally, to resize the region extracted by the crop, use the `width` and `height` parameters.

> Note:
> Country flags are SVG images and can only be cropped if a value for `format`
> is also provided.

examples.name: format
examples.description:
Specify which file format to use for the image. The valid formats are `pjpg` and `jpg`.

It's not practical to convert a lossy image format, like `jpg`, to a lossless image format, like `png`, so Shopify can do
only the following conversions:

- `png` to `jpg`
- `png` to `pjpg`
- `jpg` to `pjpg`

> Note:
> Shopify automatically detects which image formats are supported by the client (e.g. `WebP`, `AVIF`, etc.) and
> selects a file format for optimal quality and file size. When a format is specified, Shopify takes into account
> the features (e.g. progressive, alpha channel) of the specified file format when making the final automatic format selection.
> To learn more, visit https://cdn.shopify.com/.

examples.name: pad_color
examples.description: Specify a color to pad the image if the specified dimensions result in an aspect ratio that differs from the original. The color must be in hexadecimal format (`hex3` or `hex6`).

summary: Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for an image.
syntax: variable | image_url: width: number, height: number
name: image_url

deprecation_reason: The `img_tag` filter has been replaced by [`image_tag`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_tag).
description:
You can also use the `img_tag` filter on the following objects:

- [`article`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/article)
- [`collection`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/collection)
- [`image`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/image)
- [`line_item`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/line_item)
- [`product`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/product)
- [`variant`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/variant)

parameters.description: The image's alt text.
parameters.name: alt

parameters.description: The desired `class` attribute.
parameters.name: class

parameters.description: The desired image size.
parameters.name: size

examples.name: Optional parameters
examples.description:
The `img_tag` filter accepts 3 unnamed parameters, separated by commas, to specify the `alt` and `class` attributes, and the
[size](/docs/api/liquid/filters/img_url#img_url-size) of the image. Because the parameters are read in that order, you must include a value for each parameter before the last
parameter you want to specify. If you don't want to include a parameter that precedes one that you do want to include, then
you can set the value to an empty string.

> Note:
> The `size` attribute of the `img_tag` filter can't be used in conjunction with the [`img_url` filter](/docs/api/liquid/filters/img_url).
> If both are used, then the `img_url` filter will override the `size` parameter of the `img_tag` filter.

summary: Generates an HTML `<img>` tag for a given image URL.
name: img_tag

deprecation_reason: The `img_url` filter has been replaced by [`image_url`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_url).
description:
You can use the `img_url` filter on the following objects:

- [`article`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/article)
- [`collection`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/collection)
- [`image`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/image)
- [`line_item`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/line_item)
- [`product`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/product)
- [`variant`](/docs/api/liquid/objects/variant)

parameters.description: The desired image size.
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: The part of the image to show if the specified image has an aspect ratio that differs from the original.
parameters.name: crop

parameters.description: The desired pixel density.
parameters.name: scale

parameters.description: The desired image format.
parameters.name: format

examples.name: size
examples.description:
The size parameter allows you to specify the dimensions of the image up to a maximum of 5760 x 5760 px. You can specify only the width, only the height, or both, and you can also use the following named sizes:

| Name | Dimensions |
| --- | --- |
| `pico` | `16x16 px` |
| `icon` | `32x32 px` |
| `thumb` | `50x50 px` |
| `small` | `100x100 px` |
| `compact` | `160x160 px` |
| `medium` | `240x240 px` |
| `large` |`480x480 px` |
| `grande` | `600x600 px` |
| `original`<br>`master` | `1024x1024 px` |

examples.name: crop
examples.description:
The `crop` parameter allows you to specify which part of the image to show if the specified dimensions result in an aspect ratio that differs from the original. You can use the following values:

- `top`
- `center`
- `bottom`
- `left`
- `right`

The default value is `center`.

examples.name: format
examples.description:
Specify which file format to use for the image. The valid formats are `pjpg` and `jpg`.

It's not practical to convert a lossy image format, like `jpg`, to a lossless image format, like `png`, so this filter does
only the following conversions:

- `png` to `jpg`
- `png` to `pjpg`
- `jpg` to `pjpg`

> Note:
> Shopify automatically detects which image formats are supported by the client (e.g. `WebP`, `AVIF`, etc.) and
> selects a file format for optimal quality and file size. When a format is specified, Shopify takes into account
> the features (e.g. progressive, alpha channel) of the specified file format when making the final automatic format selection.
> To learn more, visit https://cdn.shopify.com/.

examples.name: scale
examples.description: Specify the pixel density of the image. The valid densities are 2 and 3.

summary: Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for an image.
name: img_url

parameters.description: The URL to link to.
parameters.name: url

examples.name: HTML attributes
examples.description: You can specify [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attributes) by including a parameter that matches the attribute name, and the desired value.

summary: Generates an HTML `<a>` tag.
name: link_to

summary: Returns the URL for an SVG image of a given [payment type](/docs/api/liquid/objects/shop#shop-enabled_payment_types).
name: payment_type_img_url

parameters.description: The desired `class` attribute.
parameters.name: class

examples.name: class
examples.description: Specify the `class` attribute of the `<svg>` tag.

summary: Generates an HTML `<svg>` tag for a given [payment type](/docs/api/liquid/objects/shop#shop-enabled_payment_types).
name: payment_type_svg_tag

description:
Accepts the following placeholder names:

| Outline illustrations | Color illustrations |
| --- | --- |
| <ul><li>`product-1`</li><li>`product-2`</li><li>`product-3`</li><li>`product-4`</li> <li>`product-5`</li><li>`product-6`</li><li>`collection-1`</li><li>`collection-2`</li><li>`collection-3`</li><li>`collection-4`</li><li>`collection-5`</li><li>`collection-6`</li><li>`lifestyle-1`</li><li>`lifestyle-2`</li><li>`image`</li></ul> | <ul><li>`product-apparel-1`</li><li>`product-apparel-2`</li><li>`product-apparel-3`</li><li>`product-apparel-4`</li><li>`collection-apparel-1`</li><li>`collection-apparel-2`</li><li>`collection-apparel-3`</li><li>`collection-apparel-4`</li><li>`hero-apparel-1`</li><li>`hero-apparel-2`</li><li>`hero-apparel-3`</li><li>`blog-apparel-1`</li><li>`blog-apparel-2`</li><li>`blog-apparel-3`</li><li>`detailed-apparel-1`</li></ul> |

parameters.description: The desired `class` attribute.
parameters.name: class

examples.name: class
examples.description: Specify the `class` attribute for the `<svg>` tag.

summary: Generates an HTML `<svg>` tag for a given placeholder name.
name: placeholder_svg_tag

description:
You should use this filter sparingly. For example, consider preloading only resources necessary for rendering
above-the-fold content. To learn more about preloading resources, refer to
[Performance best practices for Shopify themes](/themes/best-practices/performance#preload-key-resources-defer-or-avoid-loading-others).

> Tip:
> If you want to preload a stylesheet, then use [`stylesheet_tag`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/stylesheet_tag). If you want to
> preload an image, then use [`image_tag`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_tag).

The input to this filter must be a URL from one of the following filters:

- [`asset_url`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/asset_url)
- [`global_asset_url`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/global_asset_url)
- [`shopify_asset_url`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/shopify_asset_url)

The `preload_tag` filter also requires an [`as` parameter](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/link#attr-as)
based on the kind of resource being preloaded.

parameters.description: The type of element or resource to preload.
parameters.name: as

examples.name: HTML attributes
examples.description: You can specify [HTML attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/link#attributes) by adding a parameter that matches the attribute name, and the desired value.
examples.syntax: string | preload_tag: as: string, attribute: string

summary:
Generates an HTML `<link>` tag with a `rel` attribute of `preload` to prioritize loading a given Shopify-hosted asset.
The asset URL is also added to the [Link header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Link)
with a `rel` attribute of `preload`.
name: preload_tag

deprecation_reason: The `product_img_url` filter has been replaced by [`image_url`](/docs/api/liquid/filters/image_url).
description: This can be the product's `featured_image` or any image from the `images` array.

parameters.description: The desired image size.
parameters.name: size

examples.name: The size parameter
examples.description: By default, the `product_img_url` filter returns the `small` version of the image (100 x 100 px). However, you can specify a [size](/docs/api/liquid/filters/img_url#img_url-size).

summary: Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for a [product image](/docs/api/liquid/objects/product).
name: product_img_url

summary: Generates an HTML `<script>` tag for a given resource URL. The tag has a `type` attribute of `text/javascript`.
name: script_tag

description:
The following are the globally accessible Shopify assets:

- `option_selection.js`
- `api.jquery.js`
- `shopify_common.js`
- `customer_area.js`
- `currencies.js`
- `customer.css`
summary: Returns the [CDN URL](/themes/best-practices/performance/platform#shopify-cdn) for a globally accessible Shopify asset.
name: shopify_asset_url

parameters.description: The type of media that the resource applies to.
parameters.name: media

parameters.description: Whether the resource should be preloaded.
parameters.name: preload

examples.name: preload
examples.description:
Specify whether the stylesheet should be preloaded.

When `preload` is set to `true`, a resource hint is sent as a [Link header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Link) with a `rel` value of
[`preload`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types/preload).

```liquid
Link: <STYLESHEET_URL>; rel=preload; as=style
```

This option doesn't affect the HTML link tag directly.

You should use the `preload` parameter sparingly. For example, consider preloading only render-blocking stylesheets that
are needed for initial functionality of the page, such as above-the-fold content. To learn more about resource hints in
Shopify themes, refer to [Performance best practices for Shopify themes](/themes/best-practices/performance#preload-key-resources-defer-or-avoid-loading-others).

summary:
Generates an HTML `<link>` tag for a given resource URL. The tag has the following parameters:

| Attribute | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `rel` | `stylesheet` |
| `type` | `text/css` |
| `media` | `all` |
name: stylesheet_tag

parameters.description: The weight unit to use in place of the default weight unit.
parameters.name: weight_unit

examples.name: Override the default unit
examples.description: You can specify a unit to override the default from the general settings.
examples.raw_liquid:
{%- assign variant = product.variants.first -%}

{{ variant.weight | weight_with_unit: variant.weight_unit }}

summary:
Generates a formatted weight for a [`variant` object](/docs/api/liquid/objects/variant#variant-weight). The weight unit is
set in the [general settings](https://www.shopify.com/admin/settings/general) in the Shopify admin.
name: weight_with_unit
